content:
Size Struct

Definition

Stores an ordered pair of integers, which specify a stem.Drawing.Size.Height* and stem.Drawing.Size.Width*.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter(typeof(System.Drawing.SizeConverter))]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public struct Size
Inheritance
Object
System.ValueType
Size

Remarks

The Size class is used to specify a height and width through the Size property for Rectangle, RectangleF, Image, Icon and other graphics classes. You can perform operations on a Size by using the overloaded operators such as op_Addition, op_Subtraction, and op_Equality. The unit for the Height and Width of the Size structure depend on the PageUnit and PageScale settings for the Graphics object that is used to draw.

Constructors

Size(Point)

Initializes a new instance of the Size structure from the specified Point structure.

public Size (System.Drawing.Point pt);
pt
Point

The Point structure from which to initialize this Size structure.

Size(Int32,Int32)

Initializes a new instance of the Size structure from the specified dimensions.

public Size (int width, int height);
width
Int32

The width component of the new Size.

height
Int32

The height component of the new Size.

Fields

Empty

Gets a Size structure that has a stem.Drawing.Size.Height* and stem.Drawing.Size.Width* value of 0.

public static readonly System.Drawing.Size Empty;

Properties

Height

Gets or sets the vertical component of this Size structure.

public int Height { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The vertical component of this Size structure, typically measured in pixels.

Remarks

The unit for the Height and Width of the Size structure depend on the PageUnit and PageScale settings for the Graphics object that is used to draw.

IsEmpty

Tests whether this Size structure has width and height of 0.

public bool IsEmpty { get; }
Value
Boolean

This property returns true when this Size structure has both a width and height of 0; otherwise, false.

Width

Gets or sets the horizontal component of this Size structure.

public int Width { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The horizontal component of this Size structure, typically measured in pixels.

Remarks

The unit for the Height and Width of the Size structure depend on the PageUnit and PageScale settings for the Graphics object used to draw.

Methods

Add(Size,Size)

Adds the width and height of one Size structure to the width and height of another Size structure.

public static System.Drawing.Size Add (System.Drawing.Size sz1, System.Drawing.Size sz2);
sz1
Size

The first Size structure to add.

sz2
Size

The second Size structure to add.

Returns
Size

A Size structure that is the result of the addition operation.

Ceiling(SizeF)

Converts the specified SizeF structure to a Size structure by rounding the values of the Size structure to the next higher integer values.

public static System.Drawing.Size Ceiling (System.Drawing.SizeF value);
value
SizeF

The SizeF structure to convert.

Returns
Size

The Size structure this method converts to.

Equals(Object)

Tests to see whether the specified object is a Size structure with the same dimensions as this Size structure.

public override bool Equals (object obj);
obj
Object

The Object to test.

Returns
Boolean

true if obj is a Size and has the same width and height as this Size; otherwise, false.

GetHashCode()

Returns a hash code for this Size structure.

public override int GetHashCode ();
Returns
Int32

An integer value that specifies a hash value for this Size structure.

Remarks

You should avoid depending on GetHashCode for unique values, as two Size objects with the same values for their Width and Height properties may return the same hash code. This behavior could change in a future release.

Round(SizeF)

Converts the specified SizeF structure to a Size structure by rounding the values of the SizeF structure to the nearest integer values.

public static System.Drawing.Size Round (System.Drawing.SizeF value);
value
SizeF

The SizeF structure to convert.

Returns
Size

The Size structure this method converts to.

Subtract(Size,Size)

Subtracts the width and height of one Size structure from the width and height of another Size structure.

public static System.Drawing.Size Subtract (System.Drawing.Size sz1, System.Drawing.Size sz2);
sz1
Size

The Size structure on the left side of the subtraction operator.

sz2
Size

The Size structure on the right side of the subtraction operator.

Returns
Size

A Size structure that is a result of the subtraction operation.

ToString()

Creates a human-readable string that represents this Size structure.

public override string ToString ();
Returns
String

A string that represents this Size.

Truncate(SizeF)

Converts the specified SizeF structure to a Size structure by truncating the values of the SizeF structure to the next lower integer values.

public static System.Drawing.Size Truncate (System.Drawing.SizeF value);
value
SizeF

The SizeF structure to convert.

Returns
Size

The Size structure this method converts to.

Operators

op_Addition(Size,Size)

Adds the width and height of one Size structure to the width and height of another Size structure.

public static System.Drawing.Size op_Addition (System.Drawing.Size sz1, System.Drawing.Size sz2);
sz1
Size

The first Size to add.

sz2
Size

The second Size to add.

Returns
Size

A Size structure that is the result of the addition operation.

op_Equality(Size,Size)

Tests whether two Size structures are equal.

public static bool op_Equality (System.Drawing.Size sz1, System.Drawing.Size sz2);
sz1
Size

The Size structure on the left side of the equality operator.

sz2
Size

The Size structure on the right of the equality operator.

Returns
Boolean

true if sz1 and sz2 have equal width and height; otherwise, false.

op_Explicit(Size) 

public static System.Drawing.Point op_Explicit (System.Drawing.Size size);
size
Size

To be added.

Returns
Point

To be added.

op_Implicit(Size) 

public static System.Drawing.SizeF op_Implicit (System.Drawing.Size p);
p
Size

To be added.

Returns
SizeF

To be added.

op_Inequality(Size,Size)

Tests whether two Size structures are different.

public static bool op_Inequality (System.Drawing.Size sz1, System.Drawing.Size sz2);
sz1
Size

The Size structure on the left of the inequality operator.

sz2
Size

The Size structure on the right of the inequality operator.

Returns
Boolean

true if sz1 and sz2 differ either in width or height; false if sz1 and sz2 are equal.

op_Subtraction(Size,Size)

Subtracts the width and height of one Size structure from the width and height of another Size structure.

public static System.Drawing.Size op_Subtraction (System.Drawing.Size sz1, System.Drawing.Size sz2);
sz1
Size

The Size structure on the left side of the subtraction operator.

sz2
Size

The Size structure on the right side of the subtraction operator.

Returns
Size

A Size structure that is the result of the subtraction operation.
